   5  from farmUtil import untarme    6  from farmUtil import samtimestamp, samresponse    7  from farmUtil import commander, commanderTimeout, isProjectThere    8  from make_desc_file import make_desc_file    9  from make_desc_root import make_desc_root   10  from checkBuffers import checkBuffers   11  import commands   12  #   13  #   14  #   15  def startWorker (reco_vers, station, project_name, cmddir, logdir, samdb,    16                   outdir_root, outlogdir, preco_anal, restart,    17                   restart_analysis_name, no_of_events):   18     19      try:   20          verbose = 1   21     22          JobDone = "No More Files Available !"   23          recotime = 200   24     25          scratchdir = os.environ['FBS_SCRATCH']   26          os.chdir(scratchdir)   27       28          HOST=os.popen('hostname').readlines(0)[0][0:-1]   29          USER=os.popen('whoami').readlines(0)[0][0:-1]   30         31          if os.environ.has_key('FBS_PROC_NO'):   32                  full_job_id = os.environ['FBS_PROC_NO']   33                  farm_job_id = os.environ['FBS_JOB_ID']   34                  farm_disk_area=os.environ['FBS_SCRATCH']   35                  disk_area="/local/stage2/sam"   36                  disk_area1="/local/stage2/sam1"   37                  print "full_job_id, farm_job_id, farm_disk_area, disk_area: ", full_job_id, farm_job_id, farm_disk_area, disk_area    38          else:   39                  print "no variable FBS_PROC_NO defined"   40                  sys.exit(0)   41     42          N=os.environ['FBS_PROC_NO']   43          JID=farm_job_id    44     45          if restart == "TRUE":   46             analysis_name = restart_analysis_name   47             old_farm_job_id = string.split(analysis_name,".")    48             JID = old_farm_job_id[-1]   49          else:   50             analysis_name = "farm."+reco_vers+"."+farm_job_id   51             JID = farm_job_id        52     53     54          os.environ['SAM_STATION'] = "protofarm"   55          os.environ['SAM_PROJECT'] = analysis_name   56          os.environ['SAMLOG']=logdir+"/"+farm_job_id+"_"+N+"_sam.log"    57          os.environ['FSSLOG']=logdir+"/"+farm_job_id+"_"+N+"_fss.log"   58          os.environ['JOBSUM']=logdir+"/"+farm_job_id+".sum"   59  #   60          print " Start running worker job on analysis project " + analysis_name    61  #   62          outdir = "/pnfs/sam/mammoth/mcc99_2/d0farm/reco"   63          outlogdir = outlogdir +"/"+JID   64  #          65  # stagger jobs a bit   66  #       wait = N+"0"   67  #       commander("sleep " + wait, verbose)   68  #   69  #...copy the executable code   70          codelocation = 'd0farm@d0bbin-farm:/home/d0farm/d0reco/'+reco_vers+'.tar'   71          command = 'fcp '+codelocation+ ' .'   72          status = commander(command,verbose)   73          if (status != 0):   74            print "copy of the code error "   75            sys.exit(0)   76  #...untar copied code   77          trytar = 0   78          while(untarme(reco_vers+'.tar') !=0 & trytar < 10):   79              print "try to untar it yet again ", trytar   80              trytar = trytar+1   81     82  # get the run_config_db   83          dblocation = 'd0farm@d0bbin-farm:/home/d0farm/d0reco/run_config_db.tar'   84          command = 'fcp '+dblocation+ ' .'   85          status = commander(command,verbose)   86          if (status != 0):   87            print "copy of the code error "   88            sys.exit(0)   89  #...untar copied code   90          os.system("rm -rf run_config_db")   91          untarme('run_config_db.tar')   92          os.system("ls ")   93  #   94  #       95          print " Farm batch jobs starting on  worker number " + N + "	" + JID+"	" + HOST   96  #   97          status = (isProjectThere(analysis_name) == 0)   98          if(status != 0):   99              print "Project error -- no project found"  100              sys.exit(0)  101  #  102  #...find consumer id  103          CIDFILE = "/home/d0farm/samjobs/"+farm_job_id+".CID"  104          print "Consumer ID file should be " + CIDFILE  105          if not(os.path.isfile(CIDFILE)):  106              print "no consumer id file "  107              sys.exit(0)  108    109          response = samresponse(CIDFILE)  110            111                112          if (response[0] == "ERROR") :  113              print "bad consumer ID"  114              sys.exit(0)  115    116          CID = response[1]  117          print "Consumer ID is " + CID  118  #  149          if (exists(disk_area+"/"+analysis_name) and restart == "TRUE"):  150              print " already have a buffer, no need to remake"  151          elif (exists(disk_area+"/"+analysis_name)):  152              #...allocate second buffer if two job from one project are running  153              #...on the same host  154              command = "sam allocate buffer --disk=" + disk_area1 + " --sizeK=2500000 --project="+ analysis_name +">> $SAMLOG"  155              disk_area_choosen = disk_area1  156          else:  157              command = "sam allocate buffer --disk=" + disk_area + " --sizeK=2500000 --project="+ analysis_name +">> $SAMLOG"  158              disk_area_choosen = disk_area  159  #  196  #  197  #-----loop over all files in the project-----  198  #  199  #  200          recentbad = 0  201          while (0==0):  202              print "begin of a loop over all files in data set"  203              userstatus = 'ok'  204  #               break  216              numtogo = checkBuffers()  217              print " there are numtogo files left"  218              if(numtogo == 0):  219                  print "see how many are local"  220                  os.system("ls -lrt "+disk_area_choosen+"/"+analysis_name)  221    222              RTFILE=farm_disk_area+"/getnextfile."+HOST+"."+USER+".out"  223              command = "sam get next file --cpid="+CPID+" --rtfile="+RTFILE+" >> $SAMLOG"  224  # " % status  228              if status == 123456789:  229                 #... status == 123456789 indicates that timeout occured  230                 print "timeout in sam: get next file
"   231                 cleaning(disk_area_choosen, analysis_name)  232                 sys.exit(1)  233              elif status != 0:  234                 #... status != indicates error in 'sam get next file'  235                  print "file problem delivery or last file ???????????
"   236  #               sys.exit(1)  237    238              response = samresponse(RTFILE)  239              print "response from sam get next file: ", response  240    241              the_file = response[1]  242              print "The file name is :" + the_file  243              status = (isProjectThere(analysis_name) == 0)  244              if(status !=0):  245                  print "Project has gone away"  246     247              if((the_file == "ERROR") | (the_file == "") | (the_file == "ERROR!") ):  248                  print "sam get next file response: ", response  249 raise JobDone  265    266              status = commander("ls -lrt " +  the_file,verbose)  267              status = commander("mv "+RTFILE+" lastfile",verbose)  268  #  269  #work on file--make all the processing  270  #  271    272              status = commander("ln -s "+the_file+" inputfile",verbose)  273    274              the_full_file = the_file  275              the_file = "root":         280                    outputname=the_file  281                  else:  282                    outputname="reco."+the_file+"_"+reco_vers  283                  routputname="recoA."+outputname+".root"  284              else:  285                  if preco_anal == "root":         286                    outputname=the_file  287                    status = commander("ln -s "+the_full_file+" outputfile",verbose)  288                  else:  289                    outputname="reco_"+the_file+"_"+reco_vers  290                  routputname="recoA_"+outputname+".root"  291    292              os.environ['outputfile']=outputname  293              os.environ['routputfile']=routputname  294    295              FILE_NAME=outputname  296              RFILE_NAME=routputname  297              PARENT=the_file  298              RPARENT = FILE_NAME  299    300              TIER="reconstructed"  301              RTIER = "root-tuple"  302              start=samtimestamp()  303              START_DATE = start[0]  304              START_TIME = start[1]  305              print ""  306              print " output file will be " + outputname  307              print ""  308              print " start reco on file inputfile ="+ the_file  309  #  310  #  311  #                 312              if(samdb == "prd"): commander('./runrecoanalyze ' + the_full_file + ' ' + no_of_events, verbose)   319              else:  320  # fake it  321                  status = commander('csh -vx ~/bin/runfake ' + the_full_file + ' ' + no_of_events,verbose)  322    323  #  324  #  325  # if it fails, save the offending input file  326  #  327              outdiskdir = outlogdir  328              badinput = 0  329 commander(" cat recoa.stderr ",verbose)  338  #               commander(" cat recoa.log ",verbose)  339                  outdiskdir = outlogdir+ "/badinput"  340                  userstatus = # end of the failure stuff  360    361              else:  362  # reset the bad file counter  363                  recentbad = 0  364    365              if(os.path.isfile("outputfile") and preco_anal metadata.write(string1)  389    390                  metadata.close()  391                  print string1      392                  if( badinput == 0):  393                      print "badinput is ok" command = "fcp metadata.py " + outdiskdir+"/"+outputname+".meta.py"           398                      savestatus = commander(command,verbose)*4+savestatus  399    400    401              if "recon_root":  405                   string2 = make_desc_root(RFILE_NAME,RSIZE,'recoa.out', RTIER,START_DATE, START_TIME, END_DATE,END_TIME, RPARENT, CPID_sec)  406                 else:  407 >= 4):  429                  print 'fcp or metadata problem'   430    431              if preco_anal == "recon_root" or preco_anal == "recon":  432                command = "fcp reco.out " + outdiskdir +"/logs/" + outputname + ".outlog"      433                commander(command,0)  434                command = "fcp reco.log " + outdiskdir +"/logs/" + outputname + ".errlog"  435 +"/logs/" + routputname + ".stderr"  445                commander(command,0)  446    447              command = "fcp events.read " + outdiskdir +"/logs/" + outputname + ".eventsread"  448              commander(command,0)  449              command = "fcp events.write " + outdiskdir +"/logs/" + outputname + ".eventswritten"  450              commander(command,0)  451    452    453              print if(status != 0):  458  #               print "rm of the file: " +the_file+ " failed"  459  #  460              status=commander("rm inputfile",verbose)  461              if(status != 0):  462 already processed file  478              print  " release the file " + the_file  479              if(savestatus != 0):  480                  userstatus = "copyfailed"  481                482 / poisso.F             Version:      [   current   ]           File /home/lxr/source/current//atlas/geant3/gheisha/poisso.F     1  *    2  * $Id: poisso.F,v 1.1.1.1 1997/11/03 15:30:19 atlascvs Exp $    3  *    4  * $Log: poisso.F,v $    5  * Revision 1.1.1.1  1997/11/03 15:30:19  atlascvs    6  * Importing CERNLIB version 08.21.    7  *    8  * Revision 1.1.1.1  1995/10/24 10:20:59  cernlib    9  * Geant   10  *   11  *   12  #include "geant321/pilot.h"   13  *CMZ :  3.21/02 29/03/94  15.41.38  by  S.Giani   14  *-- Author :   15        SUBROUTINE POISSO(XAV,IRAN)   16  C   17  C *** GENERATION OF POISSON DISTRIBUTION ***   18  C *** NVE 16-MAR-1988 CERN GENEVA ***   19  C   20        DIMENSION RNDM(1)   21  C ORIGIN : H.FESEFELDT (27-OCT-1983)   22  C   23  C --- USE NORMAL DISTRIBUTION FOR <X> > 9.9 ---   24        IF(XAV.GT.9.9) GOTO 2   25  C   26        MM=IFIX(5.*XAV)   27        IRAN=0   28        IF(MM.LE.0) GOTO 3   29        R=EXP(-XAV)   30        CALL GRNDM(RNDM,1)   31        RAN1=RNDM(1)   32        IF(RAN1.LE.R) RETURN   33        RR=R   34        DO 1 I=1,MM   35        IRAN=IRAN+1   36        IF(I.LE.5) RRR=XAV**I/NFAC(I)   37  C** STIRLING' S FORMULA FOR LARGE NUMBERS   38        IF(I.GT.5) RRR=EXP(I*LOG(XAV)-(I+0.5)*LOG(I*1.)+I-0.9189385)   39        RR=RR+R*RRR   40        IF(RAN1.LE.RR) RETURN   41      1 CONTINUE   42        RETURN   43  C** NORMAL DISTRIBUTION WITH SIGMA**2 = <X>   44      2 CALL NORMAL(RAN1)   45        RAN1=XAV+RAN1*SQRT(XAV)   46        IRAN=IFIX(RAN1)   47        IF(IRAN.LT.0) IRAN=0   48        RETURN   49  C** FOR VERY SMALL XAV TRY IRAN=1,2,3   50      3 P1=XAV*EXP(-XAV)   51        P2=XAV*P1/2.   52        P3=XAV*P2/3.   53        CALL GRNDM(RNDM,1)   54        RAN=RNDM(1)   55        IRAN=3   56        IF(RAN.LT.P3) RETURN   57        IRAN=2   58        IF(RAN.LT.P2) RETURN   59        IRAN=1   60        IF(RAN.LT.P1) RETURN   61        IRAN=0   62        RETURN   63        END             [ All rights reserved.      7  Rem    8  Rem    NAME    9  Rem      aqxmlusr.sql - setup Database/Internet Users    10  Rem   11  Rem    DESCRIPTION   12  Rem      This sql file is used to create AQ adminstrator , aq database user   13  Rem      and grant required privileges to AQ internet super user and also    14  Rem      grant database access to  internet AQ agents     15  Rem   16  Rem    NOTES   17  Rem         18  Rem   19  Rem    MODIFIED   (MM/DD/YY)   20  Rem    rbhyrava    02/08/02 - remove additional grants   21  Rem    rbhyrava    04/12/01 - Merged rbhyrava_aqxmldemos   22  Rem    rbhyrava    04/11/01 - Created   23  Rem   24     25  SET FEEDBACK 1   26  SET NUMWIDTH 10   27  SET LINESIZE 80   28  SET TRIMSPOOL ON   29  SET TAB OFF   30  SET PAGESIZE 100   31  SET ECHO ON   32     33  SET SERVEROUTPUT ON    34  REM    35  REM create admin and user accounts and grant http access to user   36  REM   37  CONNECT sys/change_on_install AS SYSDBA ;   38     39  GRANT CONNECT, RESOURCE, AQ_ADMINISTRATOR_ROLE    40  TO aqxmladmn IDENTIFIED BY aqxmladmn;   41     42  GRANT CONNECT, RESOURCE, AQ_USER_ROLE    43  TO aqxmluser IDENTIFIED BY aqxmluser;   44     45  GRANT EXECUTE ON dbms_lock TO PUBLIc ;   46     47  REM   48  REM grant access to admin packages    49  REM   50  GRANT EXECUTE ON dbms_aqadm TO aqxmladmn;   51  GRANT EXECUTE ON dbms_aq TO aqxmluser;   52     53  REM    54  REM Grant Create proxy session privileges to AQ servlet super-user     55  REM    56  GRANT CREATE SESSION TO scott;   57  ALTER USER aqxmluser GRANT CONNECT THROUGH scott;   58     59  REM   60  REM Create AQ Agent to access AQ Servlet using HTTP   61  REM   62  EXECUTE dbms_aqadm.create_aq_agent(agent_name=>'john', enable_http =>true);   63     64  REM   65  REM Map AQ Agent to Database user    66  REM   67  EXECUTE dbms_aqadm.enable_db_access('john', 'aqxmluser');   68     69  REM   70  REM view registered AQ agents   71  REM   72  SELECT agent_name, db_username, http_enabled    73  FROM aq$internet_users ; gvsafe.F             Version:      [   current   ]           File /home/lxr/source/current//atlas/geant3/ggeom/gvsafe.F     1  *    2  * $Id: gvsafe.F,v 1.1.1.1 1997/11/03 15:30:10 atlascvs Exp $    3  *    4  * $Log: gvsafe.F,v $    5  * Revision 1.1.1.1  1997/11/03 15:30:10  atlascvs    6  * Importing CERNLIB version 08.21.    7  *    8  * Revision 1.1.1.1  1995/10/24 10:20:57  cernlib    9  * Geant   10  *   11  *   12  #include "geant321/pilot.h"   13  *CMZ :  3.21/02 29/03/94  15.41.31  by  S.Giani   14  *-- Author :   15  *   16        FUNCTION GVSAFE (XYZ, C1, C, NC)   17  ************************************************************************   18  *                                                                      *   19  * GVSAFE Calculates the distance from a point                YB 870511 *   20  *        to a surface, and the gradient in this point.                 *   21  *        This is an approximation of the distance, which is smaller    *   22  *        than the real distance.                                       *   23  *                                                                      *   24  * Input : XYZ     point coordinates                                    *   25  *         C1      constant coefficient from the surface                *   26  *         C(1)    number of non constant coefficients from             *   27  *                       the surface                                    *   28  *         C(2),C(3),... non constant coefficients from the surface     *   29  *         NC      total number of coefficients from the surface        *   30  *                                                                      *   31  * Extra OUTPUT: COMMON/SLATE/ISLATE(2)  ISLATE(2)=ISIGN (from GVSIGN)  *   32  *               SLATE(10)    - value of S(X)                           *   33  *               SLATE(11:13) - gradient                                *   34  *               SLATE(14)    - normalisation factor for distance       *   35  *               SLATE(15)    - normalisation factor for gradient       *   36  *                                                                      *   37  ************************************************************************   38        COMMON /SLATE/ SLATE (40)   39        INTEGER        ISLATE(40)   40        EQUIVALENCE    (SLATE,ISLATE)   41        EQUIVALENCE    (JDUMM,SLATE(2))   42        REAL           XYZ(3) , C(*)   43        INTEGER        GVSIGN   44  *-----------------------------------------------------------------------   45        SLATE(14) = 1.   46        SLATE(15) = 1.   47        IF (NC.NE.2)              GO TO 200   48  *   49  *     case with simplified surface X=C0, Y=C0, Z=C0, X*2+Y*2=C0   50  *     (happens only when initialisation is done)   51  *   52        IAX = C(2)   53        SLATE(11) = 0.   54        SLATE(12) = 0.   55        SLATE(13) = 0.   56        IF (IAX.LE.3)             THEN   57          SLATE(10) = C1 + XYZ(IAX)   58          SLATE(IAX+10) = 1.   59          CC = SLATE(10)   60        ELSE   61          RXY2 = XYZ(1)**2 + XYZ(2)**2   62          RXY = SQRT(RXY2)   63          SLATE(10) = (RXY2 - C1**2)   64          SLATE(11) = 2.*XYZ(1)   65          SLATE(12) = 2.*XYZ(2)   66          SLATE(15) = 2.*RXY   67          SLATE(14) = (RXY-C1)   68          CC = SLATE(10)/SLATE(14)   69        ENDIF   70        IF (SLATE(10))            101,102,103   71    101 ISLATE(2) = -1   72        GO TO 999   73    102 ISLATE(2) = 0   74        GO TO 999   75    103 ISLATE(2) = +1   76        GO TO 999   77  *   78  *     case with surfaces with 4, 7 or 10 coefficients (normal case)   79  *   80    200 JDUMM = GVSIGN (XYZ, C1, C, NC)   81        CC    = SLATE(1)   82        SLATE(10) = SLATE(1)   83        SLATE(11) = C(2)   84        SLATE(12) = C(3)   85        SLATE(13) = C(4)   86        IF (NC .EQ. 4)            GO TO 999   87        IF (NC .EQ. 7)            THEN   88          AA = 1.   89        ELSE   90  CCC     AA = C(5)**2+C(6)**2+C(7)**2CCC        AA = C(5)**2+C(6)**2+C(7)**2   91  CCC  ++ 0.5*(C(8)**2+C(9)**2+C(10)**2)   92  CCC        AA = SQRT(AA)   93          AA = 2.0   94        ENDIF   95        CALL GVGRAD (XYZ, C, NC, SLATE(11))   96        TT2  = SLATE(11)**2 + SLATE(12)**2 + SLATE(13)**2   97        SLATE(14) = (TT2+4.*AA*ABS(CC))   98        IF (SLATE(14)-TT2.LE.0.1*TT2)     THEN   99          SLATE(15) = SQRT(SLATE(14))  100          SLATE(14) = SLATE(15)  101        ELSE  102          SLATE(15) = SQRT(TT2)  103          SLATE(14) = 0.5*(SLATE(15) + SQRT(SLATE(14)))  104        ENDIF  105        IF (ABS(SLATE(14)).LE.0.) SLATE(14) = 1.E-10  106        CC = CC / SLATE(14)  107     108    999 GVSAFE = CC  109     110        END             [   source navigation   ]   [   identifier search   ]   [   freetext search   ]   [   file search   ]   [   repository   ]       This page was automatically generated by the   LXR engine . gvlong.F             Version:      [   current   ]           File /home/lxr/source/current//atlas/geant3/ggeom/gvlong.F     1  *    2  * $Id: gvlong.F,v 1.1.1.1 1997/11/03 15:30:10 atlascvs Exp $    3  *    4  * $Log: gvlong.F,v $    5  * Revision 1.1.1.1  1997/11/03 15:30:10  atlascvs    6  * Importing CERNLIB version 08.21.    7  *    8  * Revision 1.1.1.1  1995/10/24 10:20:57  cernlib    9  * Geant   10  *   11  *   12  #include "geant321/pilot.h"   13  *CMZ :  3.21/02 29/03/94  15.41.31  by  S.Giani   14  *-- Author :   15  *   16        SUBROUTINE GVLONG (DIR, C, NC, TAU, NTAU)   17  ************************************************************************   18  *                                                                      *   19  * GVLONG calculates the distance to the surface along a      VP 920125 *   20  *        given DIRection                                               *   21  *                                                                      *   22  *        SHOULD BE called ONLY AFTER call GVSAFE.                      *   23  *        due to some results of GVSAFE are used.                       *   24  *        Just by this reason starting XYZ point                        *   25  *        is omitted                                                    *   26  *        =======================================                       *   27  *                                                                      *   28  * Input  : DIR -   direction                                           *   29  *          C   -   coeffs of surface (C(1) not used)                   *   30  *          NC  -   number of coefs                                     *   31  *                                                                      *   32  * Output : TAU -   TAU(1:2) distances to surface in increasing order   *   33  *                  in the units of the length of DIR                   *   34  *          NTAU -  number of distances (solutions)  (0,1,2)            *   35  *                                                                      *   36  ************************************************************************   37        COMMON /SLATE/ SLATE (40)   38        INTEGER        ISLATE(40)   39        EQUIVALENCE    (SLATE,ISLATE)   40        REAL           C(*), DIR(3), TAU(2), CBA(3)   41        LOGICAL        XLINE   42  *-----------------------------------------------------------------------   43  *   44  *     SLATE(10) is the value of S(X) = equation of the surface with   45  *     the point coordinates   46  *     SLATE(11),SLATE(12),SLATE(13) is the gradient to the surface   47  *   48        NTAU = 0   49        CBA(1) = SLATE(10)   50        CBA(2) = SLATE(11)*DIR(1)+SLATE(12)*DIR(2)+SLATE(13)*DIR(3)   51  *   52        CBA(3) = 0.   53        XLINE  = .TRUE.   54  *   55  **              in case of a plane   56        IF (NC.EQ.4)              GO TO 200   57  *   58  *     in case it is a simplified surface X=-C0,Y=-C0,Z=-C0, or X*2+Y*2=-C0   59  *   60        IF (NC.EQ.2)              THEN   61          IAX  = C(2)   62          IF (IAX.NE.4)           GO TO 200   63          CBA(3) = DIR(1)**2+DIR(2)**2   64        ELSE   65  *   66  **              in case it is a surface with 7 or 10 coefficients   67          CBA(3) = DIR(1)**2*C(5)+DIR(2)**2*C(6)+DIR(3)**2*C(7)   68  *   69  **              in case it is a surface with 10 coefficients   70          IF (NC.EQ.10)           THEN   71            CBA(3) = CBA(3) + C(08)*DIR(1)*DIR(2)   72            CBA(3) = CBA(3) + C(09)*DIR(2)*DIR(3)   73            CBA(3) = CBA(3) + C(10)*DIR(3)*DIR(1)   74          ENDIF   75        ENDIF   76        XLINE = .FALSE.   77  *   78    200 IF (XLINE)                THEN   79  *   80  *     in case it is a plane (4 coefficients) or a simplified surface   81  *   82          IF (1.E+6*ABS(CBA(2)).LE.ABS(CBA(1)))   GO TO 999   83          NTAU = 1   84          TAU(1) = - CBA(1)/CBA(2)   85        ELSE   86  *   87  **              in case it is a surface with 7 or 10 coefficients   88          CALL GVPSQR (CBA, TAU, NTAU)   89        ENDIF   90  *   91    999 NTAU = MAX(0,NTAU)   92        RETURN   93        END             [   source navigation   ]   [   identifier search   ]   [   freetext search   ]   [   file search   ]   [   repository   ]       This page 38 39

How Farm Executables are built

40

H. Schellman

41

November 15, 2000

42 43

44 Introduction 45

46 This document describes the procedure for creating a farm executable from a 47 d0 release. The farm executable is a tar file which contains the D0reco 48 and RecoAnalyze executables and the associated RCP databases. 49 50

51 52

53 Makeing the Executable 54

55 56
    57
  1. Log onto one of the build machines (d0lxbld1-3)
    2. 58
  2. setup the version you wish to run 59 
       60     61          newrel -t <version> <version>   62
    3. 63
  3. go into the version directory you just made
    4. 70
  4. check out the latest version of the d0reco scripts: 71 
       72  cvs checkout d0reco/scripts   73
    5. 74
  5. type d0setwa to set your working area
    6. 75
  6. type 76 
       77   buildfarmreco test LOCAL   78
    79 The LOCAL uses the latest version of d0reco scripts you just checked out. 80 If they are stable, you can omit the LOCAL and the scripts will come 81 from the release version. 88 89

    90 You can find the contents of the buildfarmreco script at: 91 d0reco/scripts/buildfarmreco

    7. 93
  7. This will make 2 things: 94 95
      96
    • A local standalone reco in test- version
      • 103
    • A tarfile which can be moved to the farms
      • 104
    8. 105
  8. To test the release 106 107
      108
    1. go into the test- version directory
      2. 115
    2. Do the following 116 
        117    118  unsetup D0RunII  119  setup TestData  120  runboth $raw_ttbar_10 10  121
      122 This should process 10 events through reco and reco_analyze. 123 124

      125 You can find runboth at: 126 d0reco/scripts/runboth

      3. 128
    9. 129
  9. To get the executable to the farm 130 
      131    132  scp <version>.tar d0farm@d0bbin:~/d0reco/.  133
    10. 134
135

136 Sam interface 137

138 You will need sam to know about your code 139 140
    141
  1. check the SAM Application page 143 to see if this version is 144 in the DB yet.
    2. 145
  2. If not, send an email to sam-adminfnal.gov 147 requesting: 148 149

    150 151 

      152    153  family/name/version  154    155  reconstruction d0reco <version>  156  analysis reco_analyze <version>  157    158  be put into the prd and int databases.  159
    3. 160
161

162 Appendix - what buildfarmreco does 163

164 buildfarmreco: 165 166

167 168

    169
  1. Gets the executables from the release
    2. 170
  2. Copies the rcp databases from the release
    3. 171
  3. Gets the files in package rundata/d0reco
    4. 172
  4. Gets some files like ptable and hmatrix which are accessed via environmentals
    5. 173
  5. Gets the run scripts from d0reco/scripts
    6. 174
  6. Puts them all into a subdirectory called $1- version
    7. 187
  7. Tars it all up into version.tar.
    8. 194
195 196

197 198

199 What the run scripts do 200

201 runboth has 2 arguments, input data file and number of events 202 203

204 It can run D0 code standalone. 205 206

207 208

    209
  1. Hacks environmentals for RCP access
    2. 210
  2. Hacks environmentals for hmatrix
    3. 211
  3. Parses the input file name and chooses the correct rcp file to run
    4. 212
  4. Runs D0reco and reco_analyze, returns error code which depends on which 213 failed.
    5. 214

Diesburg, M. Przybycien, H. Schellman}    5  \date{	oday - Version 0.1}    6  \input html.sty    7  
ewcommand{\code}[1]{{	t #1 }}    8  
ewcommand{ gv}{ egin{verbatim}}    9  
ewcommand{\env}{\end{verbatim}}   10  \parskip 5 pt   11  \parindent 0 pt   12  aggedright   13     14   egin{document}   15  \maketitle   16  	ableofcontents   17     18  \section{Documentation}   19     20  \htmladdnormallink{D0 Production page}{ http://www-d0.fnal.gov/computing/production}\    21  \htmladdnormallink{SAM}{ http://d0db.fnal.gov/sam}\    22  \htmladdnormallink{Batch System}{ http://www-isd.fnal.gov/fbsng/intro.html}\    23     24  \section{Logging in}   25     26  Need to log in to d0mino or some other fermilab machine, then ssh to   27  d0bbin and the farm nodes.  The worker nodes are not directly accessible from outside   28  Fermilab.   29     30  The official submission directory can be found in   31     32   egin{verbatim}   33  ~d0farm/<version>/farm_machinery/v1_fbsng   34  \end{verbatim}   35     36  version is currently v00-01-00   37     38  One can get a new version by   39     40   egin{verbatim}   41  cd   42  mkdir <version>   43  cd <version>   44  cvs checkout -r <version> farm_machinery   45  \end{verbatim}   46     47  \section{Submitting jobs}   48     49  \subsection{Make certain farm batch system is set up}   50  The farm batch system must be set up before a job is submitted   51     52  \code{setup fbsng}   53     54  \subsection{Submitting the job}   55     56  Currently the command is:   57     58  \code{runrecocert $<$project$>$ $<$number of nodes$>$ $<$ version of code$>$  $<$queue$>$}   59     60  typing \code{runrecocert} will dump the full argument list   61     62  \subsection{The jdf file}   63  \code{runrecocert} is currently modifies a 'jdf' file template.   64  You can change this jdf template to send you mail when each job section terminates.   65  The jdf template for the most recent submission is stored in the directory   66  you submitted the job from.   67     68  \subsection{What queues are available}   69     70  Farms are divided into 2 and then into smaller subsections.  Each node has   71  one or more color attribute and queues   72     73  The farms are divided up into 10 farmlets and 2 test machines.   74     75  The farmlets Worker\_1 through Worker\_5 are old 500 MhZ duals.   76   egin{itemize}   77  \item Worker\_test is a single node fnd01 for debugging.  Its queue is PINKQ\   78  \item Worker\_1 has 9 nodes and is for farm code testing. Its queue is GREENQ\   79  \item Worker\_2 is currently assigned to David Adams for cft work\   80  \item Worker\_3-5 are  ORANGEQ, PURPLEQ and YELLOWQ and can be combined into queue BLUEQ\   81  \item Worker\_5 has only 7 nodes so BLUEQ can have 27 nodes.\   82  \item All 47 slow nodes are queue WHITEQ   83  \end{itemize}   84     85  farmlets Worker\_6 - Worker\_10 are new 800 Mhz duals.   86     87   egin{itemize}   88  \item Worker\_test\_1 is fnd051 for testing.  Queue is DoveQ\   89  \item Worker\_6 through Worker\_10 are VermilionQ, ChartreuseQ, SienaQ, LavenderQ and CadmiumQ.\   90  \item Worker\_7-Worker\_10 are CobaltQ   91  \item Worker\_6-Worker\_10 are TitaniumQ which has 49 fast nodes   92  \end{itemize}   93     94   egin{itemize}   95  \item The queue TitaniumQ runs on 49 of the 800 Mhz duals for 98 total processors   96  \item The queue BlueQ runs on 26 of the slower 500 MhX duals for 52 processors.   97  \end{itemize}   98     99  \code{fbs queues} Shows you the names of the queues and their assigned process types.  100    101  \code{fbs hosts} Shows which worker is which.  102    103  \code{fbs lj} lists running jobs  104    105  To really see the setup you currently have to decode \code{ $\sim$farms/fbsng\_root/cfg/farm.cfg.}  106    107  We need a summary that tells you how many workers are assigned to which queue  108  automatically.  Generally one would submit to BlueQ and TitaniumQ. The others  109  are only used for testing.  110    111    112    113  \section*{Job structure}  114    115  Jobs have 3 sections.  They currently communicate by putting a little file \code{$<$jobno$>$.CID }  116  in the \code{$\sim$/samjobs } directory.  This file maps the sam info into the batch system.  117    118  \subsection{The START section}  119  This starts up the sam data delivery and then sits there until 10 hours after  120  everything has finished, trying to store all of the output files. Killing  121  the start section is not a good idea.  You can tell it to shut down by  122  getting rid of the $<jobno>$.CID file.  123    124    125  \subsection{The Worker section}  126  This is the section that starts on all of the worker nodes and runs the  127  actual jobs.  It uses SAM for data access.  128    129  \subsection{The End section}  130  This section stops the sam data delivery system and informs the START section that  131  it is time to start thinking about shutting down.  132    133  \section{Storing the output}  134  Output file storage is quasi-asynchronous, the batch job TRIES to do the stores  135  but there is no guarantee that it will actually succeed.  This is not pretty.  136    137  How it works:  138    139  Worker sections copy output files into areas on the large stripesets on d0bbin  140    141   gv  142  /d0/stripeN/samtest/<jobno>/*  143  \end{verbatim}  144    145  The start section wakes up every N seconds and tries to store all the files that are  146  in this directory. It looks for all files of type meta.py and their companion data files.  147  It then moves those files into a subdirectory \code{store\_in\_progress} and issues a sam  148  store command.  It retries a couple of times but in the end will move the file and  149  its  \code{meta.py} file into the directory \code{failure}.  The output of all of this goes into files called \code{*fsslog}  150  in the \code{ $<$jobno$>$ } directory.  151    152  After a nasty job failure you can still find the data files in the\code{ $<$jobno$>$} directory,  153  or in the \code{store\_in\_progress} or the \code{failure} directory. You may have  154  to move the files back up to the top directory and reissue the store command by hand:  155    156   gv  157  storeallfiles.py /d0/stripeN/samtest/jobno  158  \end{verbatim}  159    160    161  This is under active improvement.  162    163  \section*{Debugging file stores}  164  In principle, the system should be able to store several files/minute.  The farms  165  have a 'width' of 4 which means up to 4 simultaneous transfers can be going on.  166    167  To see what sam thinks is going on,  168    169   egin{verbatim}  170  sam dump fss  171  \end{verbatim}  172    173  To see what the tape robot thinks:  174    175  Look at the \htmladdnormallink{// http://d0ensrv2.fnal.gov/enstore/}{enstore  history page} to see if the system is really unhealthy  176    177  Also look at the \htmladdnormallink{// http://d0ensrv2.fnal.gov/enstore/}{enstore  history page}{SAMMAM  178  } movers - are they doing work for you or someone else?  179    180    181  \section*{What you see}  182  \subsection{Logs}  183  The logs of the batch scripts go into a local subdirectory \code{MONDD} with  184  the date coded in it.  185    186  The logs of reco go into  /d0/stripeX/samtest/$<$jobno$>$/logs or  187  /d0/stripeX/samtest/$<$jobno$>$/badinput/logs  188    189  where badinput is where jobs that fail end up.  190    191    192  \section{Checking the status of running jobs}  193    194   egin{verbatim}  195  fbs status [<jobno>] [<section>]  196  \end{verbatim}  197    198    199  Dumps the detailed status of a job.  200    201   egin{verbatim}  202  listjobs.py  203  \end{verbatim}  204  Lists a summary status for all of the active jobs  205  \subsection{Checking on a job}  206    207  \code{fbs monitor} is a gui which allows you to track jobs (and kill them.)  208    209    210  \section{Looking for failures in the batch/sam system}  211    212  go to the local log area (the one names MonNN).  213    214  \subsection{Tape errors}  215  These show up in sam\_$<$jobno$>$.log .  216    217  grep STATUS sam\_$<$jobno$>$.log  will tell you a lot.  218    219    220    221  \subsection{General errors in sam or scripts}  222    223  Try  224    225  grep Failure *jobno*.out  226    227  \subsection{Check on processing summary}  228    229  The END section writes a summary of the project,  look in  230  the file $<$project$>$\_$<$jobno$>$.dump. This file appears when all  231  files have been tried and includes a list of the bad ones.  232    233    234    235  \end{document}        ~  [   source navigation   ]  ~  [   diff markup   ]  ~  [   identifier search   ]  ~  [   freetext search   ]  ~  [   file search   ]  ~      This page was automatically generated by the   LXR engine . ";   24  eval { $dbh->do( 'CREATE TABLE primes ( prime NUMBER )' ); };   25  warn $@ if $@;   26     27  print "Loading table";   28  my $sth = $dbh->prepare( 'INSERT INTO primes VALUES ( ? )' );   29  while ( <DATA> ) {   30      chomp;   31      print " $_";   32      $sth->execute( $_ );   33      print " commit (", $dbh->commit, ")" if 11 == $_;   34  }   35  print "
";   36     37  my $prime;   38  print "Reading table for the first time
";   39  $sth = $dbh->prepare( 'SELECT prime FROM primes ORDER BY prime' );   40  $sth->execute;   41  $sth->bind_columns( {}, \$prime );   42  while ( $sth->fetch ) {   43      print " $prime";   44  }   45  $sth->finish;   46  print "
";   47     48  print "rollback (", $dbh->rollback, ")
";   49     50  print "Reading table for the second time.
";   51  $sth->execute;   52  $sth->bind_columns( {}, \$prime );   53  while ( $sth->fetch ) {   54      print " $prime";   55  }   56  $sth->finish;   57  print "
";   58     59  $dbh->do( 'DROP TABLE primes' );   60  print "Table Dropped
";   61  $dbh->disconnect;   62  __END__   63  2   64  3   65  5   66  7   67  11   68  13   69  17   70  19   71  23   72  29        ~  [   source navigation   ]  ~  [   diff markup   ]  ~  [   identifier search   ]  ~  [   freetext search   ]  ~  [   file search   ]  ~      This page was automatically generated by the   LXR engine . The Priming Files

21 22 23 At weekly intervals all the tables distributed by DBMauto are dumped 24 as gzipped tar files onto the directory:- 25 26 
   27    /afs/fnal.gov/files/data/minos/database_dumps   28
29 30 The file naming convention used is:- 31 32 33 <table>_nnnnnn.tar.gz 34 35 where:- 36 37 <table> is the table name e.g. PLEXPINDIODETOLED 38 nnnnnn the update number e.g. 001234 when the 39 tar file was created 40 41 42 For example, the priming file:- 43 44 
   45    PLEXPINDIODETOLED_001234.tar.gz   46
47 48 will replace the PLEXPINDIODETOLED table with 49 the version that existed in the FNAL database after it issued update 50 1234.

51 52 53 Do not apply these updates on Master Databases as this could result in the 54 loss of data. 55 56

57 58 The fact that the priming files completely replace the existing data 59 means that a crude way of keep your database in step would be just to 60 apply these priming files at intervals rather than set up DBMauto and 61 run regularly. In general the priming files are very large so this is 62 only worth considering if it is acceptable to run with a database that 63 could be several months out of date.

64 65 For the date of the latest set of priming files see: DBMauto Priming File Status

66 67 68

The Priming Tool: load_tables.sh

69 70 71 In the directory:- 72 73 
   74  $SRT_PUBLIC_CONTEXT/DatabaseMaintenance/tools/   75
76 77 you will find the tool:- 78 79 
   80  load_tables.sh    81
82 83 which is used to apply the updates. The command syntax is:- 84 85 
   86     load_tables.sh {options} <table|tar-file|list-file>   87      88   Options are:-   89      90   --database  <db>      Database name.  Default: Offline   91   --debug               Print some debug info.   92   --directory  <dir>    Directory for work space.  Default: ./   93   --host <host>         Host server.  Default: Current host.   94   --password <pswd>     Password.  "" means none. Default: ask   95   --suffix  <suffix>    Add suffix to file name. Default: none   96   --tar_dir             Directory holding tar dir.   97                         Default: /afs/fnal.gov/files/data/minos/database_dumps   98   --username <user>     Username.  Default: writer   99     100  <table|tar-file|list-file> is one of:-  101     102  o  A table e.g. CALGAINDRIFT.  103     104     Load_table looks for a file named <table>_nnnnnnnn.tar.gz  105     106  o  A tar-file.  107     108     Load_table looks for that specific file.  109     110  o  A list e.g. prime.  111     112     Load_table looks for the file <list>_nnnnnn.lis and uses the tables it contains.  113     114     Each of the main groups of tables has a list:-  115     116          cal dcs plex pulse ugli and prime  117    118  Where: nnnnnnnn is the number in FNAL_nnnnnnnn.dbm to which the tar file  119         will synchronise.  120    121
122 123 124

The Priming Procedure

125 126 127 To prime or re-prime the database proceed as follows. 128 129
    130 131
  1. If you do not have access to 132 133 
      134    /afs/fnal.gov/files/data/minos/database_dumps  135
    136 137 then use a machine that has to copy the required files to a directory 138 to which you do have access. Alternatively consider installing 139 lufs 140

    141 142

  2. If you are already running DBMauto then suspend the CRON Jobs.

    144 145

  3. Decide which tables you want to prime (not all are essential). If you want 146 to prime all the tables required for offline production then you can use the 147 list held in the file:- 148 149 
      150    prime_nnnnnn.lis  151
    152 153 So, if running on the machine that hosts the local MySQL server, and with afs access 154 to the priming directory, to prime the offline database using the writer account:- 155 156 
      157    load_tables.sh --password ....  prime  158
    159 160 will unpack each required table update in turn and apply it.

    161 162 Other examples:- 163 164 

      165    load_tables.sh --password .... --host my_server  cal  166
    167 168 Apply all calibration table priming files onto MySQL server 'my_server'.

    169 170 

      171    load_tables.sh --password ....  --tar_dir local-dir CALGAINDRIFT  172
    173 Re-prime the CALGAINDRIFT table using a copy of the priming file on the disk 174 'local-dir' 175

    176 177

  4. If already running DBMauto:- 178 179
      180
    1. Set the Update Number in the 181 FNAL_import.context 182 to nnnnnn. 183
    2. Start up DBMauto cron job. 184
    185 186

 477    }  478  }  479    480   //**********************************************************************   481     482   // Write to XML.   483     484   const   XmlElement *  Job :: xml ()  const  {  485     // Create top XML elment.   486      auto_ptr < XmlElement > pele( new   XmlElement (xml_name()));  487     // Add attributes.   488     pele-> add_attribute ( "status" , statstr(m_stat));  489    pele-> add_attribute_as_int ( "start_time" , m_start_time);  490    pele-> add_attribute_as_int ( "update_time" , m_update_time);  491    pele-> add_attribute_as_int ( "stop_time" , m_stop_time);  492    pele-> add_attribute_as_int ( "event_count" , m_event_count);  493    pele-> add_attribute_as_int ( "error" , m_error);  494     // If invalid, exit here.   495      if  ( !  is_valid () )  return  pele. release ();  496     // Add Application.   497      const   XmlElement * pxapp = m_app. xml ();  498     if  ( pxapp == 0 )  return  0;  499    pele-> add_child (pxapp);  500     // Add task.   501      const   XmlElement * pxtsk = m_tsk. xml ( false );  502     if  ( pxtsk == 0 )  return  0;  503    pele-> add_child (pxtsk);  504     // Add dataset.   505      const   XmlElement * pxdst = m_pdst-> xml ();  506     if  ( pxdst == 0 )  return  0;  507    pele-> add_child (pxdst);  508     // Add result.   509      if  ( m_pres != 0 ) {  510       const   XmlElement * pxres = m_pres-> xml ();  511       if  ( pxres == 0 )  return  0;  512      pele-> add_child (pxres);  513    }  514     // Return the XML.   515      return  pele. release ();  516  }  517    518   //**********************************************************************   519   // Free functions.   520   //**********************************************************************   521     522   // Output stream.   523     524   ostream &  print ( ostream & lhs,  const   Job &  rhs ,  string  firstword) {  525    lhs << firstword <<  " is " ;  526     Job :: Status   stat  =  rhs . status ();  527     switch  (  stat  ) {  528     case   Job ::INVALID:      lhs <<  "invalid" ;  return  lhs;  529     case   Job ::FAILED:       lhs <<  "failed"   530                                <<  " with error "  <<  rhs . error ();  break ;  531     case   Job ::INITIALIZING: lhs <<  "initializing" ;  return  lhs;  532     case   Job ::RUNNING:      lhs <<  "running" ;  break ;  533     case   Job ::DONE:         lhs <<  "done" ;  break ;  534     case   Job ::KILLED:       lhs <<  "killed" ;  break ;  535    }  536    lhs <<  endl ;  537    lhs <<  rhs .application() <<  endl ;  538    lhs <<  "Task "  <<  rhs .task().id(). to_string () <<  endl ;  539    lhs <<  "Dataset "  <<  rhs . dataset ().id(). to_string ();  540     bool  has_events =  rhs . dataset ().is< EventDataset >();  541     long   event_count  = 0;  542     if  ( has_events ) {  543       event_count  =  rhs . dataset (). cast < EventDataset >(). event_count ();  544      lhs <<  " with "  <<  event_count  <<  " events" ;  545    }  546    lhs <<  endl ;  547     const   char *  fmt  =  "%Y %B %d %X" ;  548     time_t  tim =  rhs . start_time ();  549     char  ctim[256];  550     strftime (ctim, 256,  fmt ,  localtime (&tim));  551    lhs <<  "  start time: "  << ctim <<  endl ;  552     if  (  stat  !=  Job ::RUNNING ) {  553      tim =  rhs .stop_time();  554       strftime (ctim, 256,  fmt ,  localtime (&tim));  555       time_t  dtim =  rhs .stop_time() -  rhs . start_time ();  556      lhs <<  "   stop time: "  << ctim  557          <<  " ("  << dtim <<  " sec elapsed)" ;  558    }  else  {  559      tim =  rhs .update_time();  560       strftime (ctim, 256,  fmt ,  localtime (&tim));  561       time_t  dtim =  rhs .update_time() -  rhs . start_time ();  562      lhs <<  " update time: "  << ctim  563          <<  " ("  << dtim <<  " sec elapsed)" ;  564    }  565     if  ( has_events ) {  566       long  proc_count =  rhs . event_count ();  567      lhs <<  endl ;  568      lhs <<  "Events processed: "  << proc_count;  569      lhs <<  " ("  << (100*proc_count)/ event_count  <<  "%)" ;  570    }  571     if  (  rhs . is_done () ) {  572      lhs <<  endl ;  573       if  (  rhs .has_result() ) {  574        lhs <<  "The job has a result" ;  575      }  else  {  576        lhs <<  "The job does not have a result" ;  577      }  578    }  579     return  lhs;  580  }  581    582   //**********************************************************************   583     584   // Output stream.   585     586   ostream &  operator <<( ostream & lhs,  const   Job &  rhs ) {  587     return   rhs . ostr (lhs);
